attributes.action: 2021 A level students should not have to sit exams
attributes.additional_details: Next years A level students are expected to sit A levels without actually having sat an exam for 2 years . They have missed GCSE exams , AS exams and are being expected to sit the most important exams of their lives never having sat an exam since year 10.  They have been schooled online for over a year , had no practical work  , not even seen their classmates or teachers online ! They are not equipped or ready to take on this huge challenge. They should not be expected to sit these exams as if nothing has changed
attributes.background: Keep in place the teacher assessment for 2021 A level students

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Cancel A-level and GCSE exams 2022: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566760

Reduce content for 2022 A-level and GCSE exams: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566803

Review 2022 exam arrangements for GCSEs and A-levels: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566569
